experiment.description: Meeting classification using Microsoft GPT-5 (dev-gpt-5-chat-jj) via SilverFlow LLM API

classifier.name: Microsoft GPT-5
classifier.note: GPT-5 is Microsoft's next-generation language model for enterprise applications

metadata.classification_method: LLM-powered semantic analysis with enterprise meeting taxonomy

meetings.subject: Calendar.AI Schedule | Pillar Review
meetings.bodyPreview:
Session Drivers/POCs: Santhosh Paramesh & Prathyush Kalashwaram

Meeting Objective: Review the feature adoption and coding execution progress against FY25 goals. Celebrate achievement and escalate issues that require LT support.



Pre-read material

classification.reasoning: The meeting is focused on reviewing feature adoption and coding execution progress against FY25 goals, which aligns with a formal progress review. The title includes 'Pillar Review' and the description mentions escalation to leadership and pre-read materials, both strong indicators of a structured review session rather than a planning or brainstorming meeting.
key_indicators: Title contains 'Pillar Review', indicating a structured review session
Objective explicitly states 'review the feature adoption and coding execution progress against FY25 goals'
Mentions escalation to leadership team (LT), typical in progress accountability meetings
Pre-read material provided, common in formal review meetings
60-minute duration suitable for a detailed progress review

meetings.subject: [US] Copilot Evaluation Platform Office Hour
meetings.bodyPreview:
Hi,


This Office Hour is used to answer your questions about the Copilot Evaluation Platform. If you have any questions for SEVAL, we're here to help!

Resources:
SEVAL Manual Book | Substrate Dev Center
1. Define Metrics | Substrate Dev Center

classification.reasoning: The meeting is labeled as an 'Office Hour' for answering questions about the Copilot Evaluation Platform, which suggests a primarily informational and Q&A format rather than decision-making or planning. It is likely intended for knowledge sharing and clarification, aligning most closely with an informational briefing. However, the interactive Q&A element introduces slight ambiguity compared to a pure broadcast, so confidence is slightly reduced.
key_indicators: Title includes 'Office Hour', indicating an open session for questions and information sharing
Description emphasizes answering questions and providing help on a specific platform (Copilot Evaluation Platform)
References to resources and manuals suggest informational intent rather than collaborative planning
Duration of 60 minutes is typical for informational sessions with Q&A
No indication of external attendees or decision-making agenda

Lack of explicit planning or decision-making keywords reduces likelihood of other categories
